NFL and its players union met for two hours in Dallas to talk about a new labor deal, their first formal bargaining session in more than two months. The sides issued a joint statement, saying they plan to increase the number, length and intensity of bargaining sessions so they can reach agreement before the collective bargaining agreement expires March 4. February 4th, 2011 DALLAS( AP)- NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell is not concerned about Michael Vick being billed as hosting a Super Bowl party because the Eagles quarterback told him it's not true. He has said that on numerous occasions people have been using his name about being involved in some type of a party and he had no intention of participating in that, Roger Goodell said.
